title: "The Legend of the Grail: Its Origins and Sources"
first_phrase: This text explores the revival of the Grail tradition in the 14th and 15th centuries, after a period of decline due to the Church's attempts to repress "heretical" movements. The article references various texts in which the Grail legend is told, including the cycles of Robert de Boron, the Conte du Graal by Chrestien de Troyes, and Wolfram von Eschenbach's Parzifal. The article also examines the internal sources of the Grail tradition, focusing on the theme of Avalon. In the final 200 tokens, the author explores the Arthurian legend's links to the Grail tradition and highlights its legacy into more modern times.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the literature of the Holy Grail has captivated audiences for centuries, with a variety of works such as El Conte du Graal, Grand Saint Graal, and Parzifal. The theme of Avalon, a place of mystery and divine order, features heavily in stories surrounding the Grail. By exploring the internal sources of tradition within this literary genre, readers can discover fascinating insights into the origins and evolution of this enduring tale.
